labelById.307815: 2: The Influence of Language and Culture on Identity
labelById.307817: 4: How Science and Technology Affect Our Lives
labelById.307818: 5: Factors That Impact the Quality of Life
labelById.307654: Skill Category 1: Comprehend written, audio, audiovisual, and visual text (text, pictures, and numbers).
labelById.307655: Skill 1.A: Describe the literal meaning of the text.
labelById.307658: 1.A.3: Retell or summarize information in narrative form.
labelById.307661: 1.B.1: Identify and describe patterns and trends in data.
labelById.307662: 1.B.2: Describe data from a table, chart, graph, map, or infographic.
labelById.307663: Skill Category 2: Make interdisciplinary and cultural connections.
labelById.307665: 2.A.1: Identify and/or describe content and connections among cultural topics.
labelById.307666: 2.A.2: Explain how data from a graph or table illustrate cultural topics or phenomena.
labelById.307667: 2.A.3: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to the target cultural topics or phenomena.
labelById.307668: 2.A.4: Infer cultural information from a text.
labelById.307669: Skill 2.B: Make connections in and across disciplines.
labelById.307670: 2.B.1: Identify and/or describe content and connections among interdisciplinary topics.
labelById.307671: 2.B.2: Explain how data from a graph or table illustrate interdisciplinary topics or phenomena.
labelById.307672: 2.B.3: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to interdisciplinary topics or phenomena.
labelById.307673: 2.B.4: Infer interdisciplinary information from a text.
labelById.307674: Skill Category 3: Interpret the content of written or audio text (words).
labelById.307675: Skill 3.A: Interpret the distinguishing features of a text.
labelById.307678: 3.A.3: Identify and/or describe the point(s) of view, perspective(s), tone or attitude.
labelById.307679: 3.A.4: Identify organizing and/or rhetorical structures and/or strategies.
labelById.307680: Skill 3.B: Interpret the meaning of a text.
labelById.307681: 3.B.1: Identify and/or describe similarities and/or differences among different types of texts.
labelById.307683: Skill Category 4: Make meanings from words and expressions.
labelById.307684: Skill 4.A: Determine the meaning of familiar and unfamiliar words.
labelById.307685: 4.A.1: Determine the meaning of a variety of vocabulary.
labelById.307686: 4.A.2: Deduce the meaning of unfamiliar words or expressions.
labelById.307687: Skill 4.B: Use words appropriate for a given context.
labelById.307688: 4.B.1: Use a variety of vocabulary in written and spoken communication.
labelById.307689: 4.B.2: Explain and use idiomatic and culturally authentic expressions.
labelById.307690: Skill Category 5: Communicate interpersonally by speaking with others.
labelById.307691: Skill 5.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.307692: 5.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close spoken exchanges.
labelById.307693: 5.A.2: Comprehend a spoken interlocutor's message in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307694: 5.A.3: Provide and obtain relevant information in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307695: 5.A.4: Use appropriate register and greeting for the intended target culture audience in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307696: 5.A.5: Use pronunciation that is comprehensible when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307697: 5.A.6: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307698: 5.A.7: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, asking for repetition, and paraphrasing to maintain spoken exchanges.
labelById.307699: Skill 5.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.307700: 5.B.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307701: 5.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307702: 5.B.3: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307703: 5.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken exchanges.
labelById.307704: Skill Category 6: Communicate interpersonally by writing to others.
labelById.307705: Skill 6.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal writing.
labelById.307706: 6.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close written exchanges.
labelById.307707: 6.A.2: Provide and obtain relevant information in written exchanges.
labelById.307708: 6.A.3: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written exchanges.
labelById.307709: 6.A.4: Use register appropriate for the intended target culture audience in written exchanges.
labelById.307710: 6.A.5: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, and paraphrasing to maintain written exchanges.
labelById.307711: Skill 6.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal writing.
labelById.307712: 6.B.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph length discourse in written exchanges.
labelById.307713: 6.B.2: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written exchanges.
labelById.307714: 6.B.3: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., capitalization, orthography, accents, punctuation) in written exchanges.
labelById.307715: 6.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction written exchanges.
labelById.307716: Skill Category 7: Communicate through spoken presentations.
labelById.307717: Skill 7.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational speaking.
labelById.307718: 7.A.1: Use a process to plan spoken presentations.
labelById.307719: 7.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in spoken presentations.
labelById.307720: Skill 7.B: Use appropriate vocal and visual strategies to communicate an idea for presentational speaking.
labelById.307721: 7.B.1: Produce spoken presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and a conclusion.
labelById.307722: 7.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph length discourse in spoken presentations.
labelById.307723: 7.B.3: Use pronunciation in spoken presentations that is comprehensible to speakers of the target language.
labelById.307724: 7.B.4: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery in spoken presentations.
labelById.307725: 7.B.5: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain spoken presentations.
labelById.307726: Skill 7.C: Use appropriate language and vocabulary for your audience for presentational speaking.
labelById.307727: 7.C.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken presentations.
labelById.307728: 7.C.2: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken presentations.
labelById.307729: 7.C.3: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken presentations.
labelById.307730: Skill 7.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea presentational speaking.
labelById.307731: 7.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in spoken presentations.
labelById.307732: 7.D.2: Compare features (including products, practices, and perspectives), of target cultural communities to student's own community in spoken presentations.
labelById.307733: Skill Category 8: Communicate through written presentations.
labelById.307734: Skill 8.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational writing.
labelById.307735: 8.A.1: Use a process to plan written presentations.
labelById.307736: 8.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in written presentations.
labelById.307737: Skill 8.B: Use appropriate writing strategies to communicate an idea in presentational writing.
labelById.307738: 8.B.1: Produce written presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and a conclusion.
labelById.307739: 8.B.2: Use communication strategies, such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain written presentations.
labelById.307740: Skill 8.C: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in presentational writing.
labelById.307741: 8.C.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph length discourse in written presentations.
labelById.307742: 8.C.2: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written presentations.
labelById.307743: 8.C.3: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written presentations.
labelById.307744: 8.C.4: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., capitalization, orthography, accents, punctuation) in written presentations.
labelById.307745: 8.C.5: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written presentations.
labelById.307746: Skill 8.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea for written presentations.
labelById.307747: 8.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in written presentations.
labelById.307748: 8.D.2: Integrate information from sources and cite them appropriately in written presentations.
